Octolingo

Octolingo is a live translator integrated with google hangouts. Built at MHacks 2014 in under 24 hours with Tom Shen.

We designed octolingo to be simple and inobtrusive. The only control is a language picker that controls what language the text appears in, and the language the text is read aloud in.

We used google’s visual asset guidelines (a precursor to material design, which had not been released when we finished this project) to integrate with the style of google hangouts.

Demo video from the hackathon:

Visit the Github Repo to see the code and more information about the project.

March 2014
